required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prognostic Values of Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) in Acute Myeloid Leukemia Patients With Allo-HSCT
clinical_study.official_title: A Study of Prognostic Values of Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) in Acute Myeloid Leukemia Patients With Allo-HSCT

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

brief_summary.textblock: Acute myeloid leukemia (AML) is a genetically heterogeneous disease and allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (allo-HSCT) is a curative treatment option for AML except for AML-M3. Relapse remains the major cause of treatment failure after allo-HSCT. Molecular residual disease has been shown to be a strong risk factor for relapse after HSCT. In this study, the investigators will detect mutations before/after allo-HSCT by using next-generation sequencing (NGS) technique to measure residual disease and evaluate the prognostic impact of molecular residual disease in a cohort of AML participants receiving allo-HSCT.

study_pop.textblock: subjects with the diagnosis of AML who is going to receive an allo-geneic HSCT within 30 days

overall_official.affiliation: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

facility.name: The First affiliated Hospital of SooChow University
